attributes.text:
Objects, which are used as delegates for a data binding store may implement any of the methods described in this interface. The delegate does not need implement all of the methods of this interface. If a method is not implemented the store provides a default implementation.

Note: This interface is meant to document the delegate but should not be listed in the implement key of a class unless all methods are really implemented.
The created request, depending on the implementation of the data store.
This method can change the settings on the used request by the store.
A sorted order of propertynames separated by ”.

Determinates the user defined class for the given properties string. This class could contain additional methods but needs to have the properties with the given names. Also every property needs to have a change event.

If this method is implemented, you have to add the superclass and mixins yourself to the returned class. This means that the methods {@link #getModelSuperClass} and {@link #getModelMixins} will not be called for the corresponding class.
Returns the class containing the properties corresponding to the given hash of the properties. If null will be returned, the store will create a class.
A sorted order of propertynames separated by ”.
Returns the mixins which should be included to the class, created by the store and identified by the given properties string.
Returns an array of mixins or a single mixin which will be included into the given class identified by the properties given in the parameter. If null will be returned, no mixin will be included.
A sorted order of propertynames separated by ”.
Returns the class which the created model class uses as superclass.
Returns the class which should be used as superclass corresponding to the given hash of the properties. If null will be returned, {@link qx.core.Object} will be used as superclass.
This method manipulates the data from the request and returns the manipulated data.
